summary: This bill, titled the Safe and Smart Federal Purchasing Act, mandates the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to review the procurement practices of Defense and Civilian agencies. The review will assess the national security risks potentially arising from the lowest price technically acceptable (LPTA) source selection process outlined in section 15.101–2 of the Federal Acquisition Regulation. The Director must submit a report detailing the review's findings to both the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs within 180 days of the bill's enactment.
